content.title: Purpose of Admissions Policy
content.text: Admissions is the first formal relationship between school and family. The process must be fair, transparent, child-centered, and aligned with school values, legal obligations, and long-term student success.

content.title: Policy Principles
items: Clarity: families understand criteria, timelines, and decisions.
Equity: decisions are non-discriminatory and needs-aware.
Fit and support: placement decisions are based on readiness and required support.
Integrity: marketing and communications must be truthful and verifiable.

content.title: Open Enrollment Philosophy
content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools welcome students from diverse educational backgrounds while safeguarding educational quality, class capacity, and support feasibility.

content.title: Core Admissions Criteria
items: Age appropriateness and year-level eligibility.
Academic profile and prior learning evidence.
English language readiness and EAL support requirements.
Behavioral and wellbeing considerations for safe integration.
Availability of seats and school capacity to provide required support.

content.title: Non-Discrimination Commitment
content.text: Admissions decisions must not discriminate based on religion, ethnicity, gender, disability, or socioeconomic status.

content.title: Assessment Purpose
content.text: Placement assessments are diagnostic, not selective. They identify learning profile, support needs, and appropriate entry point so the school can provide the right support from day one.

content.title: Assessment Use Cases
items: Determine best-fit year level, especially for transfer and mid-year applicants.
Identify EAL proficiency and required language support pathway.
Flag intervention needs (Tier 2/Tier 3) and referral to learning support.
Establish baseline data for progress monitoring.

content.title: Communication to Families
items: Explain clearly that tests are for support planning, not pass/fail filtering.
Share summary outcomes and recommended support actions.
Document assessment decisions in admissions record.

content.text: Enrollment must follow a standardized workflow with bilingual forms, complete documentation, and clear parent obligations.

content.title: Standard Enrollment Workflow
items: Application submission with required student and parent information.
Document verification and completeness check.
Assessment/interview scheduling and placement decision.
Offer issuance, acceptance confirmation, and fee processing.
Enrollment contract signing and onboarding handover.

content.title: Minimum Required Documentation
rows: Birth certificate, passport/KTP, family card as applicable
Medical information, allergies, relevant support documentation
Photos, signed forms, fee and contract documents

content.text: Mid-year entries require additional checks to protect learning continuity for both incoming and current students.

content.title: Decision Factors
items: Current class size and capacity limits.
Teacher workload and support availability.
Curriculum alignment and transition risk for applicant.
Priority considerations (e.g., siblings, staff families) where policy permits.

content.title: If Capacity Is Full
items: Offer waitlist placement with transparent communication.
Provide realistic timeline and update commitments.
Where possible, refer to other available Eduversal partner schools.

content.title: Truth in Advertising
content.text: All marketing materials must accurately represent actual facilities, programs, outcomes, and student experience.

content.title: Ethical Marketing Standards
items: Use authentic and current representations of facilities and learning environment.
State exactly which Cambridge pathways and subjects are currently offered.
Report examination outcomes accurately with context and cohort size.
Avoid misleading superlatives and unverifiable ranking claims.
Obtain consent for student images and testimonials.

content.title: Communication Quality Controls
items: Bilingual critical messages (English and Bahasa Indonesia).
Clear fee disclosure and conditions before commitment.
Approval workflow for public-facing marketing content.

content.text: Waitlist and appeal processes must be documented, consistent, and transparent to families.

content.title: Waitlist Process
items: Notify family of waitlist status and reason (typically capacity).
Confirm that waitlist is not rejection and application remains active.
Apply clear prioritization rules and timestamp controls.
Provide periodic updates and final decision communication.

content.title: Appeals Process
items: Family submits appeal within defined window with supporting information.
School reviews case against policy criteria and available evidence.
Principal/authorized panel provides final written decision.
All appeal outcomes are recorded for governance review.

content.text: Withdrawals must follow contractual notice periods and structured exit steps to protect academic continuity and administrative accuracy.

content.title: Exit Controls
items: Written notice to Principal and Finance Office within required timeline.
Financial settlement and clearance checks.
Issuance of transfer documentation and records handover.
Exit interview/feedback capture where applicable.

content.text: Admissions and marketing data must be managed under strict privacy controls, aligned with Indonesian obligations and GDPR-informed best practices.

content.title: Data Protection Requirements
items: Collect only necessary data for admissions, placement, and communication.
Obtain informed consent for data use, media publication, and direct communication.
Store records securely with role-based access controls.
Define retention, archival, and deletion rules for applicant records.
Provide response protocol for data access requests and breaches.

categories.title: Indonesian Regulatory Alignment
items: PPDB-related requirements for fair and non-discriminatory admissions.
Education ministry expectations on transparent school operations.
Data handling and student protection obligations under national law.

categories.title: CIS and WASC Alignment
items: Equitable access and ethical communication in admissions practice.
Operational integrity through documented policy and procedures.
Student wellbeing and support readiness during onboarding decisions.

categories.title: Cambridge and International School Expectations
items: Admissions transparency for program pathways and subject availability.
Accurate representation of academic outcomes and qualifications.
Fair placement and support planning for student success.

content.title: Policy and Process Evidence
items: Current Admissions Policy (bilingual) with version history.
Published admissions criteria, timelines, and appeal procedures.
Marketing ethics and communication approval SOPs.

content.title: Operational Evidence
items: Application forms, document checklists, and enrollment contracts.
Placement assessment summaries and support decisions.
Waitlist logs, appeal records, and decision letters.
Withdrawal notices, clearance forms, and transfer documentation.
Consent records and data access logs.

content.title: Principal
resp: Approves admissions policy, major decisions, and appeal outcomes.
Ensures compliance with legal, ethical, and accreditation standards.
Approves public marketing narratives and high-risk communications.

content.title: General Manager / Foundation Representative
resp: Oversees strategic enrollment targets and policy governance.
Monitors compliance risk and escalation decisions.
Ensures financial and legal consistency across admissions operations.

content.title: Admissions Coordinator / Team
resp: Manages application workflow, document checks, and family communication.
Coordinates assessments, waitlist updates, and onboarding steps.
Maintains complete records and reporting dashboards.

content.title: Academic and Student Support Teams
resp: Conduct placement evaluation and support readiness checks.
Recommend EAL/SEN interventions and monitor entry transition.
Provide evidence-based input for acceptance and placement decisions.

content.title: Marketing and Communications Team
resp: Produce accurate, ethical marketing and admissions content.
Ensure consent compliance for media and student stories.
Align campaigns with approved claims, data, and school identity.
